alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; Van Buren; Warren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:25PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Overton, Cumberland, southeastern De Kalb, northern Van Buren, northeastern Warren, White, southeastern Putnam and southwestern Fentress Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 625 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Wartburg to Smithville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Sparta, Spencer, Fairfield Glade, Monterey, Crab Orchard, Pleasant Hill, Doyle, Cumberland Mountain State Park, Slate Springs, Virgin Falls State Natural Area, Rock Island State Park, Lake Tansi, Fall Creek Falls State Park, Indian Rock Lake and Clarkrange. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 302 and 340. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; Van Buren; Warren; White
